result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kerry L Crawford

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kerry L Crawford in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Kerry L Crawford.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Peter Hauser. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 09.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kerry L Crawford in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Kerry L Crawford.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Thomas Harris to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Reimbursement may be ordered at the conclusion of the case. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. Court adjourns matter for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary hearing court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kerry L Crawford in court in person.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court in person for Kerry L Crawford.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defense Counsel informed the court that the defendant is no longer SPD Eligible due to recent employment. Defense Counsel motions to withdraw. Court grants motion. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing to the trial court.
Indigency hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kerry L Crawford in court, appear in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion to Adjourn, filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kerry L Crawford in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Kerry L Crawford in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense motion to dismiss count 3, due to lack of information. Court denied motion.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
